sources.title: Country Gentlemen
sources.description: After being run out of town after town for trying to sell worthless stock, two con artists (Ole Olsen and Chic Johnson) breeze into the small town of Chesterville, where they find themselves accused of kidnapping a young boy to whom they offered a ride.

When that misunderstanding is cleared up, the two conmen hatch a plot to unload all their worthless paper on the gullible citizens of Chesterville. sources.title: Country Gentlemen (1936) OLSEN & JOHNSON
sources.description:
Stars: Ole Olsen, Chic Johnson, Joyce Compton
 Director: Ralph Staub

 After being run out of town after town for trying to sell worthless stock, two con artists breeze into the small town of Chesterville, where they find themselves accused of kidnapping a young boy to whom they offered a ride. When that misunderstanding is cleared up, the two con men hatch a plot to unload all their worthless paper on the gullible citizens of Chesterville.

sources.title: Country Gentlemen Ole Olsen, Chic Johnson
sources.description: J.D. McAllister (Ole Olsen) and Charles Watson (Chic Johnson) are two con men on the road in search of their next target. After a trip to the town of Chesterville, the duo, with help from their secretary, Gertie (Joyce Compton), decide to buy a vacant lot and drum up money by pretending the worthles s land is actually an oil field. They attract several investors and are soon the talk of the town. But, as it becomes clear the well isn't going to produce oil any time soon, the townspeople rebel.

metadata.Plot: McAllister (Ole Olsen and Hamilton (Chic Johnson)are a couple of con-men who travel about the country selling worthless stock to small town citizens. They come to Chesterville where they see a potential sucker list in the local war-veteran's home. They sell shares to the vets in a local worthless oil-field. McAllister falls in love with the widowed-owner of their hotel, Louise Heath (Lila Lee)who persuades him to give up his shady dealings. But before he can convince his partner the townspeople catch on to their scheme and decide jail is the place for them.
metadata.Writer: Joseph Hoffman, Gertrude Orr, Milton Raison
metadata.Actors: Ole Olsen, Chic Johnson, Joyce Compton
